history.text: I have not seen this movie before but the familiar actors that are cast looks like the movie would be interesting based off of the actors choice in movies.
Yes, I usually enjoy Jim Carey movies. This one seems funny.
I'm sure Morgan Freeman is good in it too. The two of them together would be interesting.
It seems like the TV reporter, Bruce Nolan, is complaining about his life and is kind of asking god why his life is that way.
Jim Carey as God for a week. Sure to be good.
Haha! Yeah I think that would be too. If he takes over god, then does "god" take over for Jim Carey?
Or do you think that Jim Carey as god will just be dealing with everybody?

He could
 make vengeance funny
Yeah, maybe thats where karma comes from.
I think the movie deals with karma, does it?
nvrmnd
thought the paragraph changed
I think in this sense it can be Karma, haha. He has a girlfriend but is looking at another hence maybe why he is passed up on every success.
ah, like not appreciating what is around you, like in the movie
yeah, like a self realization tactic.
Or it can be a pathway of these things happen because he chose this pathway and if he were to change his thoughts and opinions maybe it would lead to another pathway changing his bad luck.

sounds like he gets there with morgan's help
. this movie has some really great actors.
Yes, however, I am unsure of who is Philip Baker and Lisa Walter.
Not sure either. So Bruce sets all the emails to answer yes to all requests. I wonder what people asked for.

The things that people ask for vary. I mean it can be forgiveness, help, the extent of life. I mean I am a religious person but saying yes to everything seems a bit extravagant because what you ask for can affect a life of another.

Just like how Bruce wanted that promotion and got the other rightful person fired. What is the person who got fired obtained that job because it was helping him take care of something meanningful like what is he had a sick wife or what not?
Plus it might not really be what you need.
Seems like its about the consequences of actions. I like to view movies as messages for the soul on how to (or not) live life.
yeah, or maybe it teaches him again to be greatful for what he already has and to not be greedy because downfalls might be downfalls because it helps another person in dyer need.
It seems like we got the plot right on the nose.
That's a good way to look at when not so good things happen.
also some of these challenges help us determine what we really want
vs choosing distractions

yeah I think that we should all be greatfull from what we all have already within our lives like someone to love, family. shelter because other people in the world are unfortunate enough to have those.
Although its hard to get past as seeing unluckiness as you need to look around and be greatful for what you already if you are that person youself.
one should always strive for what they believe their heart follows though.
Hello?
yes and to stand up to bullies. Does Jim do that in this movie?
sry, ladies room
It seems like Grace was pretty patient with him
Well Grace truely loved him aswell.
and she finally got her wish
That is good for her. I am happy to see that Jim Carey finally got himself to a true self realization of where he was suppose to be
I think we'll all get there like Jim Carey did in the movie. Especially with the help of others.
yeah, i guess its just the journey we all have to take through life.
I wonder what message the homeless man had at the end of the movie. Looks like he was in the beginning of the movie with a message as well.
Maybe he is symbolic.
